bottles.name: Taedonggang
bottles.description: This was the most difficult bottle to get by far. It's from a brewery in North Korea and it needed to be shipped to Ireland via a hop in China (the only country the brewery deals with). A pretty normal tasting lager at the end of it but the historic charm is there for all to see

bottles.name: Fallout Beer
bottles.description: A fairly standard beer but the bottle is from a survival game that I loved as a kid. If you haven't played Fallout, you really should check it out.

bottles.name: Miss Hops
bottles.description: Honestly can't remember where I got this beer. It's a hoppy blast. The brewery seems to have a good name

bottles.name: Cass Fresh
bottles.description: A Korean staple beer. Probably the Bud of Korea

bottles.name: Kingfisher Premium
bottles.description: An Indian beer. One of them beers which is popular enough to travel cross border due to its blandness

bottles.name: Centennial IPA
bottles.description: Founders are always hopped up to fuck. Very nice. But you'll regret it

bottles.name: Blue Moon
bottles.description: Horrible orange tinged yoke. Not great tbh

bottles.name: Bruge Zot
bottles.description: A local speciality from Bruge. Can't particularly say that the taste stands out but it was one of the easier to drink beers from Bruge.

bottles.name: Cerdos Voladores
bottles.description: One of the colourful Barca Beer Co bottles. The bottles look cool. I'll give em that

bottles.name: Dark IPA
bottles.description: A Yorkshire beer with a good sense fun in the decoration

bottles.name: Hopbot IPA
bottles.description: Canadian crowd. Funky bottle. IPA`liciousness

bottles.name: Piquenbauer
bottles.description: A beer dedicated to the Shakira shagger himself. Mr Gerrard

bottles.name: Nicotto
bottles.description: Japanese herb beer thingy

bottles.name: Steam Beer
bottles.description: One of the older American breweries, unfortunately seems to be gone out of business. The beer has a nice story behind it

bottles.name: Sagres
bottles.description: Portugese staple. Cheap and cheerful

bottles.name: Scraggy Bay
bottles.description: The most wonderfullest beer in the World

bottles.name: Hardcore IPA
bottles.description: Strong one. Whoosh

bottles.name: Kronenberg 1664
bottles.description: Cool blue bottle

bottles.name: Altered Amber
bottles.description: Another brewrey which is closed AFAIK.

bottles.name: Irish Dark Lager
bottles.description: Galway Hooker always have plenty of beers around. I think they own a few pubs in Dublin as well

bottles.name: Retro IPA
bottles.description: Rye River down the road. Good beers to be fair

bottles.name: Jaipur
bottles.description: Puts the Indian in IPA

bottles.name: Pale Ale
bottles.description: One of them made-to-order beers that Aldi/Lidl were selling. Think it was done by Rye River

bottles.name: Deep Sea Double IPA
bottles.description: Think it's again a beer to order type thing

bottles.name: Russian Hoppy Lager
bottles.description: No idea where this came from. Name just seemed cool

bottles.name: Extra White
bottles.description: Belgian thing. Not too strong though. A light pale ale

bottles.name: Narwhal Imperial Stout
bottles.description: Not usually a fan of the Imperial Stouts. They tend to be too strong. At 10%+, this was did not change my opinion.

bottles.name: Celebration IPA
bottles.description: A fruity festive one

bottles.name: Santa Punch IPA
bottles.description: Argentinian brewery. Certainly don't see many frm them around Ireland. Nice fun bottle design

bottles.name: Kinsale Pale Ale
bottles.description: Lovely one from a brewery in a lovely part of the country. Nothing special about the bottle but a great beer

bottles.name: Maestra Double Lupulo
bottles.description: One of the Spanish San Miguel family. Pretty strong coming in a 7+%

bottles.name: Ureich Premium Pils
bottles.description: I think I got this in Aldi or Spar or something. It's another of them really tasty German pils that come in at a ridiculously good price point

bottles.name: Leon Beer
bottles.description: From Cyprus. It was originally the first beer brewed in Cyprus and is still produced using the original recipe

bottles.name: Mandarina Bavaria
bottles.description: Irish one. Brewed to a German hop recipe. Strong one at nearly 6%

bottles.name: Flensburger Pils
bottles.description: Another of them German breweries with some serious international shipping contracts. Seems to be readily available in most off-licences

bottles.name: Blonde - Brew Master Edition
bottles.description: A brief release from Smithwicks when trying to mount the Craft bandwagon. Not sure it's still available

bottles.name: Hairy Goat
bottles.description: Another Irish one. From Cork if memory serves

bottles.name: Bru Lager
bottles.description: Fairly plain bottle but the brewery always had a good story behind it

bottles.name: Proper Job
bottles.description: Cornish IPA. Was readily available in Tesco for a while

bottles.name: Weissbrau - Kristall
bottles.description: One of them available everywhere German beers

bottles.name: Pale Ale
bottles.description: Small brewery from Longford

bottles.name: Bru Rua
bottles.description: Not usually a fan of reds but have to support the locals

bottles.name: Irish Red Ale
bottles.description: Another one of them made to order deals for Aldi or Lidl

bottles.name: Of Foam And Fury
bottles.description: Galway Bay have good beers but the doubles kill me. This was 8%

bottles.name: Finians Premium Lager
bottles.description: Another very small local brewery

bottles.name: Stony Grey
bottles.description: Monaghan based farm brewer

bottles.name: Hollows & Fentimans Ginger Beer
bottles.description: UK based brewer. You can get this stuff in tons of places. Interesting that you mix it with some bitters before drinking

bottles.name: West Indies Porter
bottles.description: Guinness relaunched this as an attempt to compete in the craft market. A hopped up recipe for over-seas travel

bottles.name: McGargles - Cousin Rosies
bottles.description: A local beer that has been pushed hard internationally

bottles.name: Foreign Extra
bottles.description: Another of the Guinness alternatives. Basically a rebrand of the West Indies Porter

bottles.name: Hop Devil
bottles.description: American brewery, from Philly apparently. Not really sure how I ended up with the bottle tbh

bottles.name: Kentucky IPA
bottles.description: American brewery from... you guess it... Kentucky.
